name: Sea of Confusion
preparation:
Beverage director Houston Eaves, the beverage director at The Esquire Tavern in San Antonio, oversees the menu, crafting visually stunning drinks like the Sea of Confusion, served tall over crushed ice with a layered effect from a float of Angostura bitters and Lemon Hart 151 rum. The funky goodness of Hamilton Jamaican pot-still gold rum takes a slightly fruity, floral and bitter turn when it mixes with Clear Creek pear brandy, Yellow Chartreuse and Cappelletti amaro sfumato rabarbaro.

This recipe originally appeared as part of “11 Hottest Cocktails to Drink in Bars Now: September 2018.”

Add the first six ingredients to a footed pilsner glass over pebble ice and swizzle.

Add the bitters and Lemon Hart 151 rum to top.

Garnish with 2 mint sprigs.
